clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise Training and Hepatic Metabolism in Overweight/Obese Adolescent
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of an Exercise Program on Hepatic Metabolism and Cardiovascular Health in Overweight/Obese Adolescent From Bogota, Colombia (HEPAFIT Study)

brief_summary.textblock: The HEPAFIT Study aims to examine whether a 6-months physical education program has benefits on hepatic metabolism and cardiovascular health as well as on selected physical fitness and mental health outcomes among adolescent overweight/obese from Bogota, Colombia.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in hepatic fat measured by magnetic resonance imaging
primary_outcome.description: Changes in hepatic fat fraction measured by magnetic resonance imaging after the 6 months intervention program

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Overweight or obesity status
- 11-17 years old
- Written informed consent
- Interested in improving health and fitness
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any other conditions which, in opinion of the investigators, would adversely affect the conduct of the trial.
- Clinical diagnosis of diabetes
- Pregnancy
- Drugs/alcohol abuse
